isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - UPPER REVERSE IDLER SHAFT

figure.caption: Figure 152. Upper Reverse Idler Shaft Assembly - Previous Design
Figure 153. Upper Reverse Idler Shaft Assembly - Current Design

note.para: The installation procedure is the same as that for the lower reverse idler shaft.

step1.para: Lift the mainshaft reverse gear to allow the reverse idler gear to drop into mesh and into the proper position.
Place and hold the idler flat thrust washer at the back of the gear.
While holding the gear and washer in position, feed the reverse idler shaft through the flat thrust washer and gear.

Position the slotted thrust washer in front of the reverse idler gear with one of the slots facing up, and continue to feed the idler shaft forward. Make sure the word FRONT faces the front of the main case.
With a soft bar and driver, drive the reverse idler shaft fully into position.
Secure the shaft in position according to one of the procedures below:

Inspect the nylon locking insert in the nut, and replace the nut if it is excessively worn. After inspecting and/or replacing the nut, install the nut and washer on shaft front. Tighten the nut to 91 to 102 Nm (67 to 75 ft-lbs).
Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the bolt threads, and install the bolt and washer. Tighten the bolt to 91 to 102 Nm (67 to 75 ft-lbs).
